title: 104_s831
content: SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF CERTAIN CONTRIBUTIONS MADE PURSUANT TO VETERANS' REEMPLOYMENT RIGHTS. Section 414 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include special rules for veterans' reemployment rights regarding employer contributions under individual account plans. Contributions made by an employer due to an employee's rights under chapter 43 of title 38, United States Code, are not subject to certain limitations and do not cause the plan to fail to meet requirements. The amendment to Section 414 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes special rules for veterans' reemployment rights regarding employer contributions under individual account plans. Contributions made by an employer due to an employee's rights under chapter 43 of title 38, United States Code, are not subject to certain limitations and do not cause the plan to fail to meet requirements. Additional elective deferrals made under paragraph (2) are treated as employer contributions required by the employee's rights under chapter 43. The amendment to Section 414 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes special rules for veterans' reemployment rights regarding employer contributions under individual account plans. Employers must allow employees to make additional elective deferrals and provide matching contributions for such deferrals during the reemployment period. The amendment to Section 414 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows veterans to make up for missed elective deferrals during qualified military service. The amount required is based on what the individual would have been allowed to contribute if they had continued working during that time. Adjustments are made for any deferrals already made during the military service period. The amendment allows veterans to make up for missed elective deferrals during qualified military service, including loan repayment suspensions. Qualified military service is defined as any service in the uniformed services. The amendment allows veterans to make up for missed elective deferrals during qualified military service, including loan repayment suspensions. It applies to individuals entitled to reemployment rights under chapter 43 of title 38, United States Code. The amendment, effective as of September 2, 1974, includes individual account plans like defined contribution and eligible deferred compensation plans.
